snippet: Frustration remains, even though New York City has one of the most aggressive antimold programs in the country.
abstract: Residents and advocates march through streets of Midland Beach neighborhood on Staten Island to demand more help from city to clean up mold, left behind after Hurricane Sandy; small demonstration coincides with release of survey detailing what residents say is an inadequate response by Bloomberg administration to help them remove mold from their homes.
lead_paragraph: Frustration remains, even though New York City has one of the most aggressive antimold programs in the country.

headline.seo: Staten Island Residents Want City to Do More to Eliminate Post-Storm Mold in Homes
headline.main: Amid Creeping Mold, Calls for City’s Help
headline.print_headline: Amid Creeping Mold, Calls for City’s Help
